page.title: 20St.Michael's School.(contd.)
page.content: In 1962 Mrs Watkins became headmistress.When she took over the school there were only 72 pupils but since we moved to Hazeldon in 1983 there have been 120 pupils.We do not know the exact date that Hazeldon was built but above the side door is a bell dated 1836.We know that in 1842 the tenants, Christopher Bridgeman and Mrs Ann Downs, had their tithes changed to rent of Â£1.19s.9d.which they paid to the Duke of Bedford.In 1911 Mr.Francis Southby purchased the house and grounds from the Duke for Â£2,100.Mr.Southby had a boys preparatory school in the house from about 1900.In 1949 Hazeldon was bought by Kelly College in memory of Kelly boys killed in the war.It was used as a boys' boarding house and later a girls' boarding house.In 1983 St. Michael's School moved into Hazeldon.
